clinical_study.brief_title: An Asthma Mobile Intervention to Promote Patient-Reported Outcomes in Primary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Adapting, Scaling, and Spreading an Algorithmic Asthma Mobile Intervention to Promote Patient-Reported Outcomes Within Primary Care Settings

brief_summary.textblock: Through this study, the investigators will adapt the ASTHMAXcel mobile app and evaluate the adapted intervention through a randomized controlled trial.

detailed_description.textblock: Through this study, the investigators will use patient and provider feedback to adapt the ASTHMAXcel mobile intervention, and will conduct a randomized controlled trial to test the intervention's impact on clinical and process outcomes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Through the randomized controlled trial component, there will be 2 arms, which include the ASTHMAXcel intervention and usual care delivered through the outpatient primary care setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline asthma quality of life to 2, 6, and 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Patients' asthma quality of life measured by the mini-Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (mini-AQLQ)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction measured by the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire-8
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction measured by the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire-8

secondary_outcome.measure: Provider perception of self-performance measured by the Asthma Physicians' Practice Assessment Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Provider perception of self-performance measured by the Asthma Physicians' Practice Assessment Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline asthma knowledge to 2 months, 6 months, and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Asthma knowledge as measured by the validated KASE asthma questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient acceptance of ASTHMAXcel intervention as measured by the UTAUT questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Patient acceptance of ASTHMAXcel intervention as measured by the UTAUT questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline asthma control to 2, 6, and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Asthma symptom burden as measured by the Asthma Control Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression as measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire-9
secondary_outcome.description: Depression as measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire-9

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of asthma emergency department visits
secondary_outcome.description: Number of asthma emergency department visits

arm_group.description: The ASTHMAXcel arm represents the study intervention, which is a patient-facing mobile application for adult patients with asthma.
This arm represents usual care delivered in the outpatient primary care setting at the study sites.

intervention.description: ASTHMAXcel is a mobile application (patient-facing) that delivers guideline-based asthma education.
Usual care delivered through the outpatient primary care setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
English-speaking individuals >18 years with:
1. persistent asthma(diagnosis made by a healthcare provider) on a daily controller medication
2. able to give informed consent
3. Smartphone (iOS or Android) access
Exclusion Criteria:
1. use of oral corticosteroids in the 2 weeks prior to the baseline visit
2. pregnancy
3. severe psychiatric or cognitive problems that would prohibit an individual from completing the protocol
4. patients that previously received ASTHMAXcel
